name: Sulfadimethoxine
source: Abraham M.H. and Acree Jr. W.E. The solubility of liquid and solid compounds in dry octan-1-ol. Chemosphere (2013)
Reason: Sulfadimethoxine has a melting point of 180-185°C. The basic unit for comparison is sulfanilamide, which has a melting point of 160-165°C. The presence of the sulfonamide functional group increases the melting point due to the potential for hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions, which can raise it by approximately +20°C. The presence of the methoxy group introduces a bulky functional group that can increase the melting point by approximately +10°C due to steric hindrance and increased molecular volume. The presence of the dimethylamino functional group also increases the melting point due to the potential for hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions, which can raise it by approximately +20°C. The presence of the sulfur atom in the molecule can also increase the melting point due to the potential for hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions, which can raise it by approximately +20°C.
